Exaggerate: The claim may be considered an exaggeration because it presents a counterargument to the commonly held belief that tribes are limited to one casino each in Oregon.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the "one casino per tribe" idea is false.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Coquille Indian Tribe has the right to build a second casino based on their interpretation of the compact agreement.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the Coquille Indian Tribe's desire to build a second casino, such as economic factors or competition with other tribes.
